title: If I'm writing a research literature review, and I'm often rephrasing existing research (but synthesizing writing from multiple sources), am I doing it wrong? - Quora

response.answer_text: If I'm writing a research literature review, and I'm often rephrasing existing research (but synthesizing writing from multiple sources), am I doing it wrong? No, you’re not. Besides paraphrasing you can even quote sources to some degree. The editor and diligent reviewers may expect you to not only cite/quote the information but also to establish a new view on the body of knowledge published so far. I assume that’s what you mean by “synthesizing”.

As long as you’ve found that the information from each source is credible, it’s fine to rephrase the writing. (A good way to make sure the source is credible is to see if you can find the same information on more than one site.) By rewriting, you’re avoiding plagiarism.. So no you’re not doing it wrong!
